H0.text: Which dynasty ruled China from 1368 to 1644. Yuan Dynasty

H1.text: Which dynasty ruled China from 1368 to 1644. Qing Dynasty

H2.text: Which dynasty ruled China from 1368 to 1644. Han Dynasty

H3.text: Which dynasty ruled China from 1368 to 1644. 明朝

A4.text: The Ming dynasty, officially the Great Ming, was an imperial dynasty of China that ruled from 1368 to 1644, following the collapse of the Mongol-led Yuan dynasty.

A5.text: The last Yuan emperor fled north to the upper capital Shangdu, and Zhu declared the founding of the Ming dynasty after razing the Yuan palaces in Dadu to the ground; the city was renamed Beiping in the same year.
